32995559.title: The Avon Longitudinal Study of Parents and Children - A resource for COVID-19 research: Questionnaire data capture May-July 2020.

sentences.text: The Avon Longitudinal Study of Parents and Children (ALSPAC) is a prospective population-based cohort study which recruited pregnant women in 1990-1992 and has followed these women, their partners and their offspring ever since.
sentences.text_new: [CLS] the a ##von longitudinal study of parents and children (alspac) is a prospective population-based cohort study which recruited pregnant women in 1990-1992 and has followed these women, their partners and their offspring ever since. [SEP]

sentences.text: The study reacted rapidly to the coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) pandemic, deploying an online questionnaire early on during lockdown (from 9 th April to 15 th May).
sentences.text_new: [CLS] the study reacted rapidly to the coronavirus disease 2019 (covid-19) pandemic, deploying an online questionnaire early on during lockdown (from 9 th april to 15 th may). [SEP]

sentences.text: In late May 2020, a second questionnaire was developed asking about physical and mental health, lifestyle and behaviours, employment and finances.
sentences.text_new: [CLS] in late may 2020, a second questionnaire was developed asking about physical and mental health, lifestyle and behaviours, employment and finances. [SEP]

sentences.text: The online questionnaire was deployed across the parent and offspring generations between the 26th May and 5 th July 2020.
sentences.text_new: [CLS] the online questionnaire was deployed across the parent and offspring generations between the 26th may and 5 th july 2020. [SEP]

sentences.text: 6482 participants completed the questionnaire (2639 original mothers, 1039 original fathers/partners, 2711 offspring (mean age ~28 years) and 93 partners of offspring).

sentences.text: 1039 new participants who did not respond to the first questionnaire deployed in April completed the second questionnaire.

sentences.text: The observational data from both COVID questionnaires will be complemented with linkage to health records and results of biological testing as they become available.
sentences.text_new: [CLS] the observational data from both covid questionnaires will be complemented with linkage to health records and results of biological testing as they become available. [SEP]

sentences.text: Data has been released as an update to the original dataset released in May 2020.

sentences.text: It comprises: 1) a standard dataset containing all participant responses to both questionnaires with key sociodemographic factors and 2) as a composite release coordinating data from the existing resource, thus enabling bespoke research across all areas supported by the study.

32995556.title: Surveillance of endemic human coronaviruses (HCoV-NL63, OC43 and 229E) associated with childhood pneumonia in Kilifi, Kenya.

sentences.text: Introduction: Human coronaviruses (HCoVs) circulate endemically in human populations, often with seasonal variation.
sentences.text_new: [CLS] introduction: human coronaviruses (hcovs) circulate endemically in human populations, often with seasonal variation. [SEP]

sentences.text: We describe the long-term patterns of paediatric disease associated with three of these viruses, HCoV-NL63, OC43 and 229E, in coastal Kenya.
sentences.text_new: [CLS] we describe the long-term patterns of paediatric disease associated with three of these viruses, hcov-nl63, oc43 and 229e, in coastal kenya. [SEP]

sentences.text: Methods: Continuous surveillance of pneumonia admissions was conducted at the Kilifi county hospital (KCH) located in the northern coastal region of Kenya.
sentences.text_new: [CLS] methods: continuous surveillance of pneumonia admissions was conducted at the kilifi county hospital (kch) located in the northern coastal region of kenya. [SEP]

sentences.text: Children aged <5 years admitted to KCH with clinically defined syndromic severe or very severe pneumonia were recruited.
sentences.text_new: [CLS] children aged < 5 years admitted to kch with clinically defined syndromic severe or very severe pneumonia were recruited. [SEP]

sentences.text: Respiratory samples were taken and tested for 15 virus targets, using real-time polymerase chain reaction.
sentences.text_new: [CLS] respiratory samples were taken and tested for 15 virus targets, using real-time polymerase chain reaction. [SEP]

sentences.text: Unadjusted odds ratios were used to estimate the association between demographic and clinical characteristics and HCoV positivity.
sentences.text_new: [CLS] unadjusted odds ratios were used to estimate the association between demographic and clinical characteristics and hcov positivity. [SEP]

sentences.text: Results: From 2007 to 2019, we observed 11,445 pneumonia admissions, of which 314 (3.9%) tested positive for at least one of the HCoV types surveyed in the study.
sentences.text_new: [CLS] results: from 2007 to 2019, we observed 11, 445 pneumonia admissions, of which 314 (3. 9 %) tested positive for at least one of the hcov types surveyed in the study. [SEP]

sentences.text: There were 129 (41.1%) OC43, 99 (31.5%) 229E, 74 (23.6%) NL63 positive cases and 12 (3.8%) cases of HCoV to HCoV coinfection.
sentences.text_new: [CLS] there were 129 (41. 1 %) oc43, 99 (31. 5 %) 229e, 74 (23. 6 %) nl63 positive cases and 12 (3. 8 %) cases of hcov to hcov coinfection. [SEP]

sentences.text: Among HCoV positive cases, 47% (n=147) were coinfected with other respiratory virus pathogens.
sentences.text_new: [CLS] among hcov positive cases, 47 % (n = 147) were coinfected with other respiratory virus pathogens. [SEP]

sentences.text: The majority of HCoV cases were among children aged <1 year (66%, n=208), though there was was no change in the proportion infected by age.
sentences.text_new: [CLS] the majority of hcov cases were among children aged < 1 year (66 %, n = 208), though there was was no change in the proportion infected by age. [SEP]

sentences.text: HCoV-OC43 was predominant of the three HCoV types throughout the surveillance period.
sentences.text_new: [CLS] hcov-oc43 was predominant of the three hcov types throughout the surveillance period. [SEP]

sentences.text: Evidence for seasonality was not identified.
sentences.text_new: [CLS] evidence for seasonality was not identified. [SEP]

sentences.text: Conclusions: Overall, 4% of paediatric pneumonia admissions were associated with three endemic HCoVs, with a high proportion of cases co-occurring with another respiratory virus, no clear seasonal pattern, and with the age-distribution of cases following that of pneumonia admissions (i.e. highest in infants).
sentences.text_new: [CLS] conclusions: overall, 4 % of paediatric pneumonia admissions were associated with three endemic hcovs, with a high proportion of cases co-occurring with another respiratory virus, no clear seasonal pattern, and with the age-distribution of cases following that of pneumonia admissions (i. e. highest in infants). [SEP]

sentences.text: These observations suggest, at most, a small severe disease contribution of endemic HCoVs in this tropical setting and offer insight into their potential future burden and epidemiological characteristics.
sentences.text_new: [CLS] these observations suggest, at most, a small severe disease contribution of endemic hcovs in this tropical setting and offer insight into their potential future burden and epidemiological characteristics. [SEP]

32995555.title: COVID-19 and Guillain-Barre Syndrome: a systematic review of case reports.

sentences.text: Background: Guillain-Barre Syndrome (GBS) is a neurological autoimmune disease that can lead to respiratory failure and death.
sentences.text_new: [CLS] background: guillain-barre syndrome (gbs) is a neurological autoimmune disease that can lead to respiratory failure and death. [SEP]

sentences.text: Whether COVID-19 patients are at high risk of GBS is unknown.
sentences.text_new: [CLS] whether covid-19 patients are at high risk of gbs is unknown. [SEP]

sentences.text: Through a systematic review of case reports, we aimed to summarize the main features of patients with GBS and COVID-19.
sentences.text_new: [CLS] through a systematic review of case reports, we aimed to summarize the main features of patients with gbs and covid-19. [SEP]

sentences.text: Methods: Without any restrictions, we searched MEDLINE, Embase, Global Health, Scopus, Web of Science and MedXriv (April 23 rd, 2020).
sentences.text_new: [CLS] methods: without any restrictions, we searched medline, embase, global health, scopus, web of science and medxriv (april 23 rd, 2020). [SEP]

sentences.text: Two reviewers screened and studied titles, abstracts and reports.
sentences.text_new: [CLS] two reviewers screened and studied titles, abstracts and reports. [SEP]

sentences.text: We extracted information to characterize sociodemographic variables, clinical presentation, laboratory results, treatments and outcomes.
sentences.text_new: [CLS] we extracted information to characterize sociodemographic variables, clinical presentation, laboratory results, treatments and outcomes. [SEP]

sentences.text: Results: Eight reports (n=12 patients) of GBS and COVID-19 were identified; one was a Miller Fisher case.
sentences.text_new: [CLS] results: eight reports (n = 12 patients) of gbs and covid-19 were identified; one was a miller fisher case. [SEP]

sentences.text: The age ranged between 23 and 77 years, and there were more men (9/102).
sentences.text_new: [CLS] the age ranged between 23 and 77 years, and there were more men (9 / 102). [SEP]

sentences.text: GBS symptoms started between 5 and 24 days after those of COVID-19.
sentences.text_new: [CLS] gbs symptoms started between 5 and 24 days after those of covid-19. [SEP]

sentences.text: The protein levels in cerebrospinal fluid samples ranged between 40 and 193 mg/dl.
sentences.text_new: [CLS] the protein levels in cerebrospinal fluid samples ranged between 40 and 193 mg / dl. [SEP]

sentences.text: None of the cerebrospinal fluid samples tested positive for COVID-19.
sentences.text_new: [CLS] none of the cerebrospinal fluid samples tested positive for covid-19. [SEP]

sentences.text: Six patients debuted with ascendant weakness and three with facial weakness.
sentences.text_new: [CLS] six patients debuted with ascendant weakness and three with facial weakness. [SEP]

sentences.text: Five patients had favourable evolution, four remained with relevant symptoms or required critical care and one died; the Miller Fisher case had successful resolution.
sentences.text_new: [CLS] five patients had favourable evolution, four remained with relevant symptoms or required critical care and one died; the miller fisher case had successful resolution. [SEP]

sentences.text: Conclusions: GBS is emerging as a disease that may appear in COVID-19 patients.
sentences.text_new: [CLS] conclusions: gbs is emerging as a disease that may appear in covid-19 patients. [SEP]

sentences.text: Although limited, preliminary evidence appears to suggest that GBS occurs after COVID-19 onset.
sentences.text_new: [CLS] although limited, preliminary evidence appears to suggest that gbs occurs after covid-19 onset. [SEP]

sentences.text: Practitioners and investigators should have GBS in mind as they look after COVID-19 patients and conduct research on novel aspects of COVID-19.
sentences.text_new: [CLS] practitioners and investigators should have gbs in mind as they look after covid-19 patients and conduct research on novel aspects of covid-19. [SEP]

33002074.title: Ophthalmological emergencies and the SARS-CoV-2 outbreak.

sentences.text: Since the end of 2019, an outbreak of the severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2), originating in the Chinese city of Wuhan has spread rapidly worldwide causing thousands of deaths.

sentences.text: Coronavirus disease (COVID-19) is supported by SARS-CoV-2 and represents the causative agent of a potentially fatal disease that is of great global public health concern.
sentences.text_new: [CLS] coronavirus disease (covid-19) is supported by sars-cov-2 and represents the causative agent of a potentially fatal disease that is of great global public health concern. [SEP]

sentences.text: The purpose of this study is to analyze how the pandemic has affected the patient's accesses to the Ophthalmological Emergency Department of a tertiary referral center in central-northern Italy, during the lockdown period.

sentences.text: The charts of all patients that came to the Emergency Department during the lockdown period (March 10 -May 4, 2020) have been retrospectively collected and compared with those in the same period of 2019 and the period from 15 January- 9 March 2020.

sentences.text: A significant reduction of visits during the lockdown has been observed, compared with those of pre-lockdown period (reduction of 65.4%) and with those of the same period of 2019 (reduction of 74.3%).

sentences.text: Particularly, during the lockdown, minor and not urgency visits decreased whereas the undeferrable urgency ones increased.

33002052.title: Using a rapid assessment methodology to identify and address immediate needs among low-income households with children during COVID-19.

sentences.text: OBJECTIVE Brighter Bites is a school-based health promotion program that delivers fresh produce and nutrition education to low-income children and families.
sentences.text_new: [CLS] objective brighter bites is a school-based health promotion program that delivers fresh produce and nutrition education to low-income children and families. [SEP]

sentences.text: Due to COVID-19-related school closures, states were under "shelter in place" orders, and Brighter Bites administered a rapid assessment survey to identify social needs among their families.
sentences.text_new: [CLS] due to covid-19-related school closures, states were under " shelter in place " orders, and brighter bites administered a rapid assessment survey to identify social needs among their families. [SEP]

sentences.text: The purpose of this study is to demonstrate the methodology used to identify those with greatest social needs during this time ("high risk"), and to describe the response of Brighter Bites to these "high risk" families.
sentences.text_new: [CLS] the purpose of this study is to demonstrate the methodology used to identify those with greatest social needs during this time (" high risk "), and to describe the response of brighter bites to these " high risk " families. [SEP]

sentences.text: METHODS The rapid assessment survey was collected in April 2020 across Houston, Dallas, Washington DC, and Southwest Florida.
sentences.text_new: [CLS] methods the rapid assessment survey was collected in april 2020 across houston, dallas, washington dc, and southwest florida. [SEP]

sentences.text: The survey consisted of items on disruption of employment status, financial hardship, food insecurity, perceived health status and sociodemographics.
sentences.text_new: [CLS] the survey consisted of items on disruption of employment status, financial hardship, food insecurity, perceived health status and sociodemographics. [SEP]

sentences.text: The open-ended question "Please share your greatest concern at this time, or any other thoughts you would like to share with us".
sentences.text_new: [CLS] the open-ended question " please share your greatest concern at this time, or any other thoughts you would like to share with us ". [SEP]

sentences.text: was asked at the end of each survey to triage "high risk" families.
sentences.text_new: [CLS] was asked at the end of each survey to triage " high risk " families. [SEP]

sentences.text: Responses were then used to articulate a response to meet the needs of these high risk families.
sentences.text_new: [CLS] responses were then used to articulate a response to meet the needs of these high risk families. [SEP]

sentences.text: RESULTS A total of 1048 families completed the COVID-19 rapid response survey, of which 71 families were triaged and classified as "high risk" (6.8% of survey respondents).
sentences.text_new: [CLS] results a total of 1048 families completed the covid-19 rapid response survey, of which 71 families were triaged and classified as " high risk " (6. 8 % of survey respondents). [SEP]

sentences.text: During this time, 100% of the "high risk" participants reported being food insecure, 85% were concerned about their financial stability, 82% concerned about the availability of food, and 65% concerned about the affordability of food.
sentences.text_new: [CLS] during this time, 100 % of the " high risk " participants reported being food insecure, 85 % were concerned about their financial stability, 82 % concerned about the availability of food, and 65 % concerned about the affordability of food. [SEP]

sentences.text: A qualitative analysis of the high-risk group revealed four major themes: fear of contracting COVID19, disruption of employment status, financial hardship, and exacerbated food insecurity.
sentences.text_new: [CLS] a qualitative analysis of the high-risk group revealed four major themes: fear of contracting covid19, disruption of employment status, financial hardship, and exacerbated food insecurity. [SEP]

sentences.text: In response, Brighter Bites pivoted, created, and deployed a framework to immediately address a variety of social needs among those in the "high risk" category.

33002041.title: Clinical laboratory parameters associated with severe or critical novel coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19): A systematic review and meta-analysis.

sentences.text: BACKGROUND To date, several clinical laboratory parameters associated with Coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) severity have been reported.
sentences.text_new: [CLS] background to date, several clinical laboratory parameters associated with coronavirus disease 2019 (covid-19) severity have been reported. [SEP]

sentences.text: However, these parameters have not been observed consistently across studies.
sentences.text_new: [CLS] however, these parameters have not been observed consistently across studies. [SEP]

sentences.text: The aim of this review was to assess clinical laboratory parameters which may serve as markers or predictors of severe or critical COVID-19.
sentences.text_new: [CLS] the aim of this review was to assess clinical laboratory parameters which may serve as markers or predictors of severe or critical covid-19. [SEP]

sentences.text: METHODS AND FINDINGS We conducted a systematic search of MEDLINE, Embase, Web of Science, CINAHL and Google Scholar databases from 2019 through April 18, 2020, and reviewed bibliographies of eligible studies, relevant systematic reviews, and the medRxiv pre-print server.
sentences.text_new: [CLS] methods and findings we conducted a systematic search of medline, embase, web of science, cinahl and google scholar databases from 2019 through april 18, 2020, and reviewed bibliographies of eligible studies, relevant systematic reviews, and the medrxiv pre-print server. [SEP]

sentences.text: We included hospital-based observational studies reporting clinical laboratory parameters of confirmed cases of COVID-19 and excluded studies having large proportions (>10%) of children and pregnant women.
sentences.text_new: [CLS] we included hospital-based observational studies reporting clinical laboratory parameters of confirmed cases of covid-19 and excluded studies having large proportions (> 10 %) of children and pregnant women. [SEP]

sentences.text: Two authors independently carried out screening of articles, data extraction and quality assessment.
sentences.text_new: [CLS] two authors independently carried out screening of articles, data extraction and quality assessment. [SEP]

sentences.text: Meta-analyses were done using random effects model.
sentences.text_new: [CLS] meta-analyses were done using random effects model. [SEP]

sentences.text: Meta-median difference (MMD) and 95% confidence interval (CI) was calculated for each laboratory parameter.
sentences.text_new: [CLS] meta-median difference (mmd) and 95 % confidence interval (ci) was calculated for each laboratory parameter. [SEP]

sentences.text: Forty-five studies in 6 countries were included.
sentences.text_new: [CLS] forty-five studies in 6 countries were included. [SEP]

sentences.text: Compared to non-severe COVID-19 cases, severe or critical COVID-19 was characterised by higher neutrophil count (MMD: 1.23 [95% CI: 0.58 to 1.88] ×109 cells/L), and lower lymphocyte, CD4 and CD8 T cell counts with MMD (95% CI) of -0.39 (-0.47, -0.31) ×109 cells/L, -204.9 (-302.6, -107.1) cells/μl and -123.6 (-170.6, -76.6) cells/μl, respectively.
sentences.text_new: [CLS] compared to non-severe covid-19 cases, severe or critical covid-19 was characterised by higher neutrophil count (mmd: 1. 23 [ 95 % ci: 0. 58 to 1. 88 ] ×109 cells / l), and lower lymphocyte, cd4 and cd8 t cell counts with mmd (95 % ci) of-0. 39 (-0. 47,-0. 31) ×109 cells / l,-204. 9 (-302. 6,-107. 1) cells / μl and-[SEP]

sentences.text: Other notable results were observed for C-reactive protein (MMD: 36.97 [95% CI: 27.58, 46.35] mg/L), interleukin-6 (MMD: 17.37 [95% CI: 4.74, 30.00] pg/ml), Troponin I (MMD: 0.01 [0.00, 0.02] ng/ml), and D-dimer (MMD: 0.65 [0.45, 0.85] mg/ml).
sentences.text_new: [CLS] other notable results were observed for c-reactive protein (mmd: 36. 97 [ 95 % ci: 27. 58, 46. 35 ] mg / l), interleukin-6 (mmd: 17. 37 [ 95 % ci: 4. 74, 30. 00 ] pg / ml), troponin i (mmd: 0. 01 [ 0. 00, 0. 02 ] ng / ml), and d-dimer (mmd: 0. 65 [ 0. 45, 0. 85 ] mg / ml). [SEP]

sentences.text: CONCLUSIONS Relative to non-severe COVID-19, severe or critical COVID-19 is characterised by increased markers of innate immune response, decreased markers of adaptive immune response, and increased markers of tissue damage and major organ failure.
sentences.text_new: [CLS] conclusions relative to non-severe covid-19, severe or critical covid-19 is characterised by increased markers of innate immune response, decreased markers of adaptive immune response, and increased markers of tissue damage and major organ failure. [SEP]

sentences.text: These markers could be used to recognise severe or critical disease and to monitor clinical course of COVID-19.
sentences.text_new: [CLS] these markers could be used to recognise severe or critical disease and to monitor clinical course of covid-19. [SEP]

33002036.title: Estimating the severity of COVID-19: Evidence from the Italian epicenter.

sentences.text: We provide results on the level of COVID-19 excess mortality in the Italian region of Lombardy and in the province of Bergamo using official and original data sources.
sentences.text_new: [CLS] we provide results on the level of covid-19 excess mortality in the italian region of lombardy and in the province of bergamo using official and original data sources. [SEP]

sentences.text: Since February 2020 Lombardy and in particular the province of Bergamo have been severely hit by the novel COVID-19 infectious disease.
sentences.text_new: [CLS] since february 2020 lombardy and in particular the province of bergamo have been severely hit by the novel covid-19 infectious disease. [SEP]

sentences.text: Combining official statistics, retrospective data and original data (i.e., obituaries and death notices) we provide a tentative estimate of the number of deaths either directly or indirectly, associated with COVID-19 as well as the total number of persons infected.
sentences.text_new: [CLS] combining official statistics, retrospective data and original data (i. e., obituaries and death notices) we provide a tentative estimate of the number of deaths either directly or indirectly, associated with covid-19 as well as the total number of persons infected. [SEP]

sentences.text: Our findings suggest that the reported number of deaths attributable to COVID-19 identified by public authorities accounts only for one half of the observed excess mortality between March 2020 and previous years.

33002032.title: In-silico design of a potential inhibitor of SARS-CoV-2 S protein.

sentences.text: The SARS-CoV-2 virus has caused a pandemic and is public health emergency of international concern.
sentences.text_new: [CLS] the sars-cov-2 virus has caused a pandemic and is public health emergency of international concern. [SEP]

sentences.text: As of now, no registered therapies are available for treatment of coronavirus infection.
sentences.text_new: [CLS] as of now, no registered therapies are available for treatment of coronavirus infection. [SEP]

sentences.text: The viral infection depends on the attachment of spike (S) glycoprotein to human cell receptor angiotensin-converting enzyme 2 (ACE2).
sentences.text_new: [CLS] the viral infection depends on the attachment of spike (s) glycoprotein to human cell receptor angiotensin-converting enzyme 2 (ace2). [SEP]

sentences.text: We have designed a protein inhibitor (ΔABP-D25Y) targeting S protein using computational approach.
sentences.text_new: [CLS] we have designed a protein inhibitor (δabp-d25y) targeting s protein using computational approach. [SEP]

sentences.text: The inhibitor consists of two α helical peptides homologues to protease domain (PD) of ACE2.
sentences.text_new: [CLS] the inhibitor consists of two α helical peptides homologues to protease domain (pd) of ace2. [SEP]

sentences.text: Docking studies and molecular dynamic simulation revealed that the inhibitor binds exclusively at the ACE2 binding site of S protein.
sentences.text_new: [CLS] docking studies and molecular dynamic simulation revealed that the inhibitor binds exclusively at the ace2 binding site of s protein. [SEP]

sentences.text: The computed binding affinity of the inhibitor is higher than the ACE2 and thus will likely out compete ACE2 for binding to S protein.
sentences.text_new: [CLS] the computed binding affinity of the inhibitor is higher than the ace2 and thus will likely out compete ace2 for binding to s protein. [SEP]

sentences.text: Hence, the proposed inhibitor ΔABP-D25Y could be a potential blocker of S protein and receptor binding domain (RBD) attachment.
sentences.text_new: [CLS] hence, the proposed inhibitor δabp-d25y could be a potential blocker of s protein and receptor binding domain (rbd) attachment. [SEP]

33001990.title: Ten simple rules for supporting a temporary online pivot in higher education.

sentences.text: As continued COVID-19 disruption looks likely across the world, perhaps until 2021, contingency plans are evolving in case of further disruption in the 2020-2021 academic year.
sentences.text_new: [CLS] as continued covid-19 disruption looks likely across the world, perhaps until 2021, contingency plans are evolving in case of further disruption in the 2020-2021 academic year. [SEP]

sentences.text: This includes delivering face-to-face programs fully online for at least part of the upcoming academic year for new and continuing cohorts.
sentences.text_new: [CLS] this includes delivering face-to-face programs fully online for at least part of the upcoming academic year for new and continuing cohorts. [SEP]

sentences.text: This temporary pivot will necessitate distance teaching and learning across almost every conceivable pedagogy, from fundamental degrees to professionally accredited ones.
sentences.text_new: [CLS] this temporary pivot will necess ##itate distance teaching and learning across almost every conceivable pedagogy, from fundamental degrees to professionally accredited ones. [SEP]

sentences.text: Each institution, program, and course will have its own myriad of individualized needs; however, there is a common question that unites us all: how do we provide teaching and assessment to students in a manner that is accessible, fair, equitable, and provides the best learning whilst acknowledging the temporary nature of the pivot?
sentences.text_new: [CLS] each institution, program, and course will have its own myriad of individualized needs; however, there is a common question that unites us all: how do we provide teaching and assessment to students in a manner that is accessible, fair, equitable, and provides the best learning whilst acknowledging the temporary nature of the pivot? [SEP]

sentences.text: No "one size fits all" solution exists, and many of the choices that need to be made will be far from simple; however, this paper provides a starting point and basic principles to facilitate discussions taking place around the globe by balancing what we know from the pedagogy of online learning with the practicalities imposed by this crisis and any future crises.

33001967.title: Seroprevalence of SARS-CoV-2 antibodies in people with an acute loss in their sense of smell and/or taste in a community-based population in London, UK: An observational cohort study.

sentences.text: BACKGROUND Loss of smell and taste are commonly reported symptoms associated with coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19); however, the seroprevalence of severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2) antibodies in people with acute loss of smell and/or taste is unknown.
sentences.text_new: [CLS] background loss of smell and taste are commonly reported symptoms associated with coronavirus disease 2019 (covid-19); however, the seroprevalence of severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (sars-cov-2) antibodies in people with acute loss of smell and / or taste is unknown. [SEP]

sentences.text: The study aimed to determine the seroprevalence of SARS-CoV-2 antibodies in a community-based population with acute loss of smell and/or taste and to compare the frequency of COVID-19 associated symptoms in participants with and without SARS-CoV-2 antibodies.
sentences.text_new: [CLS] the study aimed to determine the seroprevalence of sars-cov-2 antibodies in a community-based population with acute loss of smell and / or taste and to compare the frequency of covid-19 associated symptoms in participants with and without sars-cov-2 antibodies. [SEP]

sentences.text: It also evaluated whether smell or taste loss are indicative of COVID-19 infection.
sentences.text_new: [CLS] it also evaluated whether smell or taste loss are indicative of covid-19 infection. [SEP]

sentences.text: METHODS AND FINDINGS Text messages, sent via primary care centers in London, United Kingdom, invited people with loss of smell and/or taste in the preceding month, to participate.
sentences.text_new: [CLS] methods and findings text messages, sent via primary care centers in london, united kingdom, invited people with loss of smell and / or taste in the preceding month, to participate. [SEP]

sentences.text: Recruitment took place between 23 April 2020 and 14 May 2020.
sentences.text_new: [CLS] recruitment took place between 23 april 2020 and 14 may 2020. [SEP]

sentences.text: A total of 590 participants enrolled via a web-based platform and responded to questions about loss of smell and taste and other COVID-19-related symptoms.
sentences.text_new: [CLS] a total of 590 participants enrolled via a web-based platform and responded to questions about loss of smell and taste and other covid-19-related symptoms. [SEP]

sentences.text: Mean age was 39.4 years (SD ± 12.0) and 69.1% (n = 392) of participants were female.
sentences.text_new: [CLS] mean age was 39. 4 years (sd ± 12. 0) and 69. 1 % (n = 392) of participants were female. [SEP]

sentences.text: A total of 567 (96.1%) had a telemedicine consultation during which their COVID-19-related symptoms were verified and a lateral flow immunoassay test that detected SARS-CoV-2 immunoglobulin G (IgG) and immunoglobulin M (IgM) antibodies was undertaken under medical supervision.
sentences.text_new: [CLS] a total of 567 (96. 1 %) had a telemedicine consultation during which their covid-19-related symptoms were verified and a lateral flow immunoassay test that detected sars-cov-2 immunoglobulin g (igg) and immunoglobulin m (igm) antibodies was undertaken under medical supervision. [SEP]

sentences.text: A total of 77.6% of 567 participants with acute smell and/or taste loss had SARS-CoV-2 antibodies; of these, 39.8% (n = 175) had neither cough nor fever.
sentences.text_new: [CLS] a total of 77. 6 % of 567 participants with acute smell and / or taste loss had sars-cov-2 antibodies; of these, 39. 8 % (n = 175) had neither cough nor fever. [SEP]

sentences.text: New loss of smell was more prevalent in participants with SARS-CoV-2 antibodies, compared with those without antibodies (93.4% versus 78.7%, p < 0.001), whereas taste loss was equally prevalent (90.2% versus 89.0%, p = 0.738).
sentences.text_new: [CLS] new loss of smell was more prevalent in participants with sars-cov-2 antibodies, compared with those without antibodies (93. 4 % versus 78. 7 %, p < 0. 001), whereas taste loss was equally prevalent (90. 2 % versus 89. 0 %, p = 0. 738). [SEP]

sentences.text: Seropositivity for SARS-CoV-2 was 3 times more likely in participants with smell loss (OR 2.86; 95% CI 1.27-6.36; p < 0.001) compared with those with taste loss.
sentences.text_new: [CLS] seropositivity for sars-cov-2 was 3 times more likely in participants with smell loss (or 2. 86; 95 % ci 1. 27-6. 36; p < 0. 001) compared with those with taste loss. [SEP]

sentences.text: The limitations of this study are the lack of a general population control group, the self-reported nature of the smell and taste changes, and the fact our methodology does not take into account the possibility that a population subset may not seroconvert to develop SARS-CoV-2 antibodies post-COVID-19.
sentences.text_new: [CLS] the limitations of this study are the lack of a general population control group, the self-reported nature of the smell and taste changes, and the fact our methodology does not take into account the possibility that a population subset may not seroconvert to develop sars-cov-2 antibodies post-covid-19. [SEP]

sentences.text: CONCLUSIONS Our findings suggest that recent loss of smell is a highly specific COVID-19 symptom and should be considered more generally in guiding case isolation, testing, and treatment of COVID-19.
sentences.text_new: [CLS] conclusions our findings suggest that recent loss of smell is a highly specific covid-19 symptom and should be considered more generally in guiding case isolation, testing, and treatment of covid-19. [SEP]

33001876.title: CDC Deployments to State, Tribal, Local, and Territorial Health Departments for COVID-19 Emergency Public Health Response - United States, January 21-July 25, 2020.

sentences.text: Coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) is a viral respiratory illness caused by SARS-CoV-2.
sentences.text_new: [CLS] coronavirus disease 2019 (covid-19) is a viral respiratory illness caused by sars-cov-2. [SEP]

sentences.text: During January 21-July 25, 2020, in response to official requests for assistance with COVID-19 emergency public health response activities, CDC deployed 208 teams to assist 55 state, tribal, local, and territorial health departments.
sentences.text_new: [CLS] during january 21-july 25, 2020, in response to official requests for assistance with covid-19 emergency public health response activities, cdc deployed 208 teams to assist 55 state, tribal, local, and territorial health departments. [SEP]

sentences.text: CDC deployment data were analyzed to summarize activities by deployed CDC teams in assisting state, tribal, local, and territorial health departments to identify and implement measures to contain SARS-CoV-2 transmission (1).
sentences.text_new: [CLS] cdc deployment data were analyzed to summarize activities by deployed cdc teams in assisting state, tribal, local, and territorial health departments to identify and implement measures to contain sars-cov-2 transmission (1). [SEP]

sentences.text: Deployed teams assisted with the investigation of transmission in high-risk congregate settings, such as long-term care facilities (53 deployments; 26% of total), food processing facilities (24; 12%), correctional facilities (12; 6%), and settings that provide services to persons experiencing homelessness (10; 5%).
sentences.text_new: [CLS] deployed teams assisted with the investigation of transmission in high-risk congregate settings, such as long-term care facilities (53 deployments; 26 % of total), food processing facilities (24; 12 %), correctional facilities (12; 6 %), and settings that provide services to persons experiencing homelessness (10; 5 %). [SEP]

sentences.text: Among the 208 deployed teams, 178 (85%) provided assistance to state health departments, 12 (6%) to tribal health departments, 10 (5%) to local health departments, and eight (4%) to territorial health departments.
sentences.text_new: [CLS] among the 208 deployed teams, 178 (85 %) provided assistance to state health departments, 12 (6 %) to tribal health departments, 10 (5 %) to local health departments, and eight (4 %) to territorial health departments. [SEP]

sentences.text: CDC collaborations with health departments have strengthened local capacity and provided outbreak response support.

sentences.text: Collaborations focused attention on health equity issues among disproportionately affected populations (e.g., racial and ethnic minority populations, essential frontline workers, and persons experiencing homelessness) and through a place-based focus (e.g., persons living in rural or frontier areas).

sentences.text: These collaborations also facilitated enhanced characterization of COVID-19 epidemiology, directly contributing to CDC data-informed guidance, including guidance for serial testing as a containment strategy in high-risk congregate settings, targeted interventions and prevention efforts among workers at food processing facilities, and social distancing.

33001872.title: Changing Age Distribution of the COVID-19 Pandemic - United States, May-August 2020.

sentences.text: As of September 21, 2020, the coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) pandemic had resulted in more than 6,800,000 reported U.S. cases and more than 199,000 associated deaths.
sentences.text_new: [CLS] as of september 21, 2020, the coronavirus disease 2019 (covid-19) pandemic had resulted in more than 6, 800, 000 reported u. s. cases and more than 199, 000 associated deaths. [SEP]

sentences.text: * Early in the pandemic, COVID-19 incidence was highest among older adults (1).
sentences.text_new: [CLS] * early in the pandemic, covid-19 incidence was highest among older adults (1). [SEP]

sentences.text: CDC examined the changing age distribution of the COVID-19 pandemic in the United States during May-August by assessing three indicators: COVID-19-like illness-related emergency department (ED) visits, positive reverse transcription-polymerase chain reaction (RT-PCR) test results for SARS-CoV-2, the virus that causes COVID-19, and confirmed COVID-19 cases.

[SEP]

sentences.text: Nationwide, the median age of COVID-19 cases declined from 46 years in May to 37 years in July and 38 in August.
sentences.text_new: [CLS] nationwide, the median age of covid-19 cases declined from 46 years in may to 37 years in july and 38 in august. [SEP]

sentences.text: Similar patterns were seen for COVID-19-like illness-related ED visits and positive SARS-CoV-2 RT-PCR test results in all U.S. Census regions.

sentences.text: During June-August, COVID-19 incidence was highest in persons aged 20-29 years, who accounted for >20% of all confirmed cases.
sentences.text_new: [CLS] during june-august, covid-19 incidence was highest in persons aged 20-29 years, who accounted for > 20 % of all confirmed cases. [SEP]

sentences.text: The southern United States experienced regional outbreaks of COVID-19 in June.
sentences.text_new: [CLS] the southern united states experienced regional outbreaks of covid-19 in june. [SEP]

sentences.text: In these regions, increases in the percentage of positive SARS-CoV-2 test results among adults aged 20-39 years preceded increases among adults aged ≥60 years by an average of 8.7 days (range = 4-15 days), suggesting that younger adults likely contributed to community transmission of COVID-19.

[SEP]

sentences.text: Given the role of asymptomatic and presymptomatic transmission (2), strict adherence to community mitigation strategies and personal preventive behaviors by younger adults is needed to help reduce their risk for infection and subsequent transmission of SARS-CoV-2 to persons at higher risk for severe illness.

33001871.title: Multiple COVID-19 Clusters on a University Campus - North Carolina, August 2020.

sentences.text: Preventing transmission of SARS-CoV-2, the virus that causes coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19), in institutes of higher education presents a unique set of challenges because of the presence of congregate living settings and difficulty limiting socialization and group gatherings.

sentences.text: Before August 2020, minimal data were available regarding COVID-19 outbreaks in these settings.

sentences.text: On August 3, 2020, university A in North Carolina broadly opened campus for the first time since transitioning to primarily remote learning in March.

sentences.text: Consistent with CDC guidance at that time (1,2), steps were taken to prevent the spread of SARS-CoV-2 on campus.

sentences.text: During August 3-25, 670 laboratory-confirmed cases of COVID-19 were identified; 96% were among patients aged <22 years.

sentences.text: Eighteen clusters of five or more epidemiologically linked cases within 14 days of one another were reported; 30% of cases were linked to a cluster.

sentences.text: Student gatherings and congregate living settings, both on and off campus, likely contributed to the rapid spread of COVID-19 within the university community.

sentences.text: On August 19, all university A classes transitioned to online, and additional mitigation efforts were implemented.

sentences.text: At this point, 334 university A-associated COVID-19 cases had been reported to the local health department.

sentences.text: The rapid increase in cases within 2 weeks of opening campus suggests that robust measures are needed to reduce transmission at institutes of higher education, including efforts to increase consistent use of masks, reduce the density of on-campus housing, increase testing for SARS-CoV-2, and discourage student gatherings.

sentences.text: During May-September 2020, average weekly incidence (cases per 100,000 children) among adolescents aged 12-17 years (37.4) was approximately twice that of children aged 5-11 years (19.0).

sentences.text: In addition, among school-aged children, COVID-19 indicators peaked during July 2020: weekly percentage of positive SARS-CoV-2 test results increased from 10% on May 31 to 14% on July 5; SARS-CoV-2 test volume increased from 100,081 tests on May 31 to 322,227 on July 12, and COVID-19 incidence increased from 13.8 per 100,000 on May 31 to 37.9 on July 19.

33001430.title: Wellbeing of a selection of seafarers in Eastern Adriatic Sea during the COVID-19 pandemic 2020.

sentences.text: BACKGROUND Work-related stress among seafarers is well known but a suspected excess of work-related stress due to the COVID-19 so far has not been published.
sentences.text_new: [CLS] background work-related stress among seafarers is well known but a suspected excess of work-related stress due to the covid-19 so far has not been published. [SEP]

sentences.text: The aim of the study was to evaluate the well- -being of the seafarers during the outbreak of COVID-19 pandemic and their evaluation of the precautions taken by the shipping companies.
sentences.text_new: [CLS] the aim of the study was to evaluate the well-- being of the seafarers during the outbreak of covid-19 pandemic and their evaluation of the precautions taken by the shipping companies. [SEP]

sentences.text: MATERIALS AND METHODS Seventy-two seafarers completed the General Health Questionnaire (GHQ12) with three extra questions on how the COVID-19 precautions were taken on board.

sentences.text: RESULTS The mean Likert score was 13.9 for the whole sample, corresponding to "no problems" while a subgroup of 40% had mean Likert sum scores of 16.1 (level 15-23) corresponding to "starting problems".

sentences.text: CT scan showed evidence of haemoperitoneum and splenic rupture.
sentences.text_new: [CLS] ct scan showed evidence of haemoperitoneum and splenic rupture. [SEP]

sentences.text: He underwent splenic artery embolisation and required ventilatory and circulatory support on ITU.
sentences.text_new: [CLS] he underwent splenic artery embolisation and required ventilatory and circulatory support on itu. [SEP]

sentences.text: He made a full recovery and was discharged home 3 weeks later.
sentences.text_new: [CLS] he made a full recovery and was discharged home 3 weeks later. [SEP]

sentences.text: Discussion and relevance Atraumatic splenic rupture is a rare, potentially fatal condition which has been described as a complication of haematological and non-haematological malignancies, inflammatory disorders and infections.
sentences.text_new: [CLS] discussion and relevance atraumatic splenic rupture is a rare, potentially fatal condition which has been described as a complication of haematological and non-haematological malignancies, inflammatory disorders and infections. [SEP]

sentences.text: There is emerging evidence to suggest that covid-19 has a direct destructive impact on the spleen, causing lymphoid follicle attrition and nodular atrophy in addition to microvascular thrombosis and necrosis.
sentences.text_new: [CLS] there is emerging evidence to suggest that covid-19 has a direct destructive impact on the spleen, causing lymphoid follicle attrition and nodular atrophy in addition to microvascular thrombosis and necrosis. [SEP]

sentences.text: This is the first report of atraumatic splenic rupture secondary to covid-19 infection, to our knowledge.
sentences.text_new: [CLS] this is the first report of atraumatic splenic rupture secondary to covid-19 infection, to our knowledge. [SEP]
